result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Leah M Reynolds in court with attorney Kat Mcclain.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Covers 15CM425 and 16CF17. VIS filed. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.    

15CM425:
DRI

16CF17:
Count 1 - State moves to amend to Misd. fleeing 346.04(2t).  Court grants.  Guilty plea entered.
Count 2 - DRI


The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney McClain relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW
1 yr probation concurrent with any sentence currently serving.  Must report to probation by 4:30 p.m. today.
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Costs.
DNA sample and surcharge.
27 days jail credit if revoked.


Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday/Thursday, by March 30, 2017 between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.
Plea hearing on February 16, 2017 at 11:30 am.
Body Only Nationwide.
